Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Entity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ant, EnergyBeam, Explosion, Gear, GriefSeed, Human, Incubator, Portal, Puella, TerrainTile, Wall, Witch

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The abstract class representing a movable object. It has a defined shape, and an x and y coordinate. It has a velocity vector and an angular velocity variable that are by default used by the advance() method to determine the Entity's displacement on the next tick. The advance() method is called every time the simulation is advanced, so advance() should be overridden by a subclass if customized behavior is desired.

    Note that when extending this class, you can override:

    • advance()
    • draw(Graphics g)
    • notifyCollision(Entity instigator)
    • resolveCollision(List<Entity> colliding, double dX, double dY, double dTheta)
    Author:
    Jiayin Huang, Tony Cui, Sally Hui
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • precision

        public static final double precision
        If a variable is closer to 0 than this value, then that variable is rounded to 0.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • shape

        protected java.awt.Shape shape
        The Shape object representing the appearance and collision box of this Entity.

      • grid

        protected Spacetime grid
        The Spacetime object to which this Entity belongs.

      • path

        protected QuadTreePath path
        An index used by the QuadTree in the Spacetime grid to quickly locate the quadrant in which this Entity is currently located.

      • x

        protected double x
        The Entity's x-coordinate, representing the centre of its shape.

      • y

        protected double y
        The Entity's y-coordinate, representing the centre of its shape.

      • theta

        protected double theta
        The Entity's current angle, in radians. 0 rad is pointing right. 1/2 pi rad is pointing down (since y coordinates increase downwards). Pi rad is pointing left. 3/2 pi rad is pointing up.

      • anchorX

        protected double anchorX
        The x-coordinate of the rotational center for this Entity. This coordinate is relative to the Entity's x-coordinate. By default, this value is set to 0.

      • anchorY

        protected double anchorY
        The y-coordinate of the rotational center for this Entity. This coordinate is relative to the Entity's y-coordinate. By default, this value is set to 0.

      • offsetX

        protected double offsetX
        The x-coordinate offset for the Shape of this Entity. This is relative to the Entity's x-coordinate.

      • offsetY

        protected double offsetY
        The y-coordinate offset for the Shape of this Entity. This is relative to the Entity's y-coordinate.

      • friction

        protected double friction
        Determines the velocity and angular velocity decrease that occurs at the end of every tick. 0 indicates no decrease (frictionless). 1 indicates immediate nullification of velocities (high friction).

      • velocity

        protected Vector2D velocity
        The current velocity of this Entity. The x-component represents the change in x-coordinate per tick, and the y-component represents the change in y-coordinate per tick.

      • angularVelocity

        protected double angularVelocity
        The rate by which this Entity rotates every tick. For example, if angularVelocity were pi/4, this Entity would rotate by pi/4 radians every tick.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(double x,
      double y,
      java.awt.Shape shape)
        Constructs and initializes an Entity at the given coordinates with the given shape. The shape is used for collision calculations. Sets this Entity's default configurations by calling the setOffsetToDefault() and setRotateAnchorToDefault() methods.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the Entity
        y - the y-coordinate of the Entity
        shape - the shape of the Entity

    • Method Detail

      • accelerate

        public void accelerate(double relativeTheta,
              double amount)
        Accelerates the velocity vector in the specified relative direction, by the specified amount. The direction is relative to the Entity's current orientation. For example, if this Entity were currently at a angle of pi/2 rad, and the parameters (0, 1) were passed into this method, the Entity would move in the pi/2 rad direction.
        Parameters:
        relativeTheta - the angular orientation relative to the Entity's current angle, in radians
        amount - the magnitude of the acceleration

      • accelerate

        public void accelerate(Vector2D vector)
        Adds the given vector to the current velocity vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - the vector to be added to the current velocity

      • accelerateSpin

        public void accelerateSpin(double deltaAngularVelocity)
        Changes the rotation rate by the specified amount. Adds deltaAngularVelocity to angularVelocity.
        Parameters:
        deltaAngularVelocity - the change in angular velocity, in radians per tick

      • advance

        public void advance()
        Advances the simulation by one tick. Override this method for custom behavior. By default, if the Entity is in motion, this method translates and rotates the Entity by the amounts specified by the velocity and the angular velocity variables. This method then applies the friction, decreasing the velocity and angular velocity as specified by the applyFriction() method.

      • applyFriction

        public void applyFriction()
        Reduces the velocity and angular velocity as specified by the friction variable. Multiples the magnitude of each variable by (1 - friction), and rounds them to 0 if their magnitude is smaller than the precision variable.

      • die

        protected void die()
        Removes this Entity from the Spacetime grid. With no remaining references pointing to this object, the Java garbage collector will quickly clean out the memory occupied by this object.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Draws the Entity. This method should be overridden to specify color and any other custom drawing procedures.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context in which to paint

      • getCenter

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double getCenter()
        Returns the Point2D.Double object representing the coordinates of the rotational center of this Entity at its current location.
        Returns:
        the Point2D.Double object representing the current center coordinates

      • getRelativeVector

        public Vector2D getRelativeVector(double relativeTheta,
                         double distance)
        Returns a velocity vector specified by the given relative angle and magnitude, based on this Entity's current angle. For example, if this Entity were at an orientation of pi/2 radians, and the parameters (0, 1) were passed into this method, the vector would be at angle of pi/2 radians.
        Parameters:
        relativeTheta - the relative angle of the vector, in radians
        distance - the magnitude of the vector
        Returns:
        the Velocity object with the specified vector

      • getShape

        public java.awt.Shape getShape()
        Gets the Shape representation of this Entity at its current location and angle. This method is used by the Spacetime class to determine collisions.

        If the offsetX and offsetY variables are equal to 0, then the current x and y coordinates represent the point at the upper-left corner of the Shape's bounding rectangle, before rotation. If the offsetX and offsetY variables are set to be equal to half of the Shape's width and height, the current x and y coordinates would represent the point at the center of the Shape.

        Returns:
        the shape of this Entity at its current angle and location

      • getVelocity

        public Vector2D getVelocity()
        Returns the Vector2D object representing this Entity's current velocity.
        Returns:
        the velocity vector of this Entity

      • isStatic

        public boolean isStatic()
        Determines if this Entity is currently in motion by looking at its velocity and angular velocity.
        Returns:
        true if this Entity's velocity is zero and its spin rate is zero; false otherwise

      • notifyCollision

        public void notifyCollision(Entity instigator)
        Invoked by the resolveCollision method of an Entity that has collided into this Entity as a result of translation or rotation. This method can be overridden to perform custom operations upon collision, such as damage dealing.

        The default procedure is to nullify the vectors of the instigator Entity.

        Parameters:
        instigator - the Entity that caused the collision
        See Also:
        resolveCollision(java.util.List<Entity>, double, double, double)

      • resolveCollision

        public void resolveCollision(java.util.List<Entity> colliding,
                    double dX,
                    double dY,
                    double dTheta)
        This method is invoked by the Spacetime class if a collision resulted from the translation or rotation of this Entity. It is up to this Entity to resolve this collision. This method can be overridden to implement customized procedures.

        The default procedure is to invoke the notifyCollision method of all of the Entities that this Entity is currently colliding with. While iterating through the list of colliding Entities, this method checks if any of them are Portals. If none of them are Portals, then this method reverts this Entity's movement by subtracting the specified dX, dY, and dTheta values.

        Parameters:
        colliding - the List of all of the Entities that this Entity is colliding.
        dX - the distance moved along the x-axis
        dY - the distance moved along the y-axis
        dTheta - the angle rotated
        See Also:
        notifyCollision(Entity)

      • nullifySpin

        public void nullifySpin()
        Sets angular velocity to 0.

      • nullifyVelocity

        public void nullifyVelocity()
        Sets velocity to (0,0).

      • setAngle

        protected void setAngle(double theta)
        Sets the angle of this Entity to the specified value without checking for collisions.
        Parameters:
        theta - the new angle, in radians

      • setLocation

        protected void setLocation(double x,
               double y)
        Sets the location of this Entity to the specified coordinates without checking for collisions.
        Parameters:
        x - the new x-coordinate
        y - the new y-coordinate

      • setLocationByCenter

        protected void setLocationByCenter(double centerX,
                       double centerY)
        Sets the location of this Entity by its rotational anchor without checking for collisions.

        For example, if a square is at (25,25) and its rotational center is a t a relative displacement of (5,5), calling setLocationByCenter(100,100) would set the Entity's actual x and y coordinates to (95,95). There would be no difference in function between setLocationByCenter(double,double) and setLocation(double,double) if the Entity's rotational center were exactly equal to its x and y coordinates.

        Parameters:
        centerX - the new x-coordinate for the Entity's center
        centerY - the new y-coordinate for the Entity's center

      • setOffset

        public void setOffset(double relativeX,
             double relativeY)
        Sets the offset for the Shape of this Entity. In the getShape() method, the shape is translated by this offset before rotation. This method shifts the rotational anchor coordinates in proportion to the change in the offset so that the rotational center remains the same distance from the top left corner of the shape.

        You could use call setOffset(-width/2, -height/2) to make it so that the Entity's x-coordinate and y-coordinate are equal to the Entity's center. This might make calculations less troublesome.

        Parameters:
        relativeX - the x-coordinate offset
        relativeY - the y-coordinate offset

      • setOffsetToDefault

        public void setOffsetToDefault()
        Sets the default offset of (-width/2, -height/2).

      • setRotateAnchor

        public void setRotateAnchor(double relativeX,
                   double relativeY)
        Sets the anchor point around which to rotate this shape, relative to the upper-left corner of the bounding rectangle of this Entity's shape before rotation.
        Parameters:
        relativeX - the relative x-coordinate of the anchor
        relativeY - the relative y-coordinate of the anchor

      • setRotateAnchorToDefault

        public void setRotateAnchorToDefault()
        Resets the anchor point to its default value at the center of the bounding rectangle of the Entity's shape before rotation.

      • setShape

        public void setShape(java.awt.Shape s)
        Sets the shape of this Entity. If the specified Shape is an instance of Area, this method converts it to a Path2D.Double since Area objects are not serializable. Otherwise, the Shape is aliased, so be careful.
        Parameters:
        s - the new Shape for this Entity

      • rotate

        public boolean rotate(double deltaTheta)
        Attempts to rotate this Entity by the specified angle. Only proceeds with the rotation if no collision occurs at the Entity's new orientation.
        Parameters:
        deltaTheta - the angle change, in radians
        Returns:
        true if the Entity was successfully rotated; false otherwise

      • translate

        public boolean translate(double dx,
                double dy)
        Attempts to translate this Entity by the specified amount. Only proceeds with the translation if no collision occurs at the Entity's new location.
        Parameters:
        dx - the distance to move this Entity along the x-axis
        dy - the distance to move this Entity along the y-axis
        Returns:
        true if the Entity was successfully moved; false otherwise

      • translateAtAngle

        public boolean translateAtAngle(double distance,
                       double relativeTheta)
        Attempts to translate this Entity by the specified distance, at the specified relative angle. The direction of the translation is relative to the Entity's current angle. Only proceeds with the translation if no collision occurs at the Entity's new location.
        Parameters:
        distance - how far to move this Entity
        relativeTheta - the relative angle of the vector, in radians
        Returns:
        true if the Entity was successfully moved; false otherwise

      • vectorAdvance

        protected void vectorAdvance()
        Advances this Entity's location and angle based on its velocity vector and angular velocity. Does not check for collisions.

      • vectorRevert

        protected void vectorRevert()
        Reverts this Entity's location and angle based on its velocity vector and angular velocity. i.e. applies the inverse of those vectors. Does not check for collisions.
